meanings.definition: The act of appointing someone as a deputy.
meanings.sent1: The deputization of the new officer was celebrated with a small ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The deputization of the sheriff's assistant was necessary to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: During the deputization, the mayor accidentally gave the wrong badge to the deputy.
meanings.sent4: The deputization of the young cadet brought a fresh perspective to the team.
meanings.sent5: The deputization of the security guard made the building feel safer.

meanings.definition: The process of giving someone the authority to act on behalf of another.
meanings.sent1: The deputization of the lawyer allowed her to represent the client in court.
meanings.sent2: After the deputization, the assistant had the power to make decisions in the manager's absence.
meanings.sent3: The deputization of the student council president for the day brought unexpected changes.
meanings.sent4: Her deputization as team captain inspired others to step up and lead.
meanings.sent5: The deputization of the nurse to administer vaccines was crucial during the flu season.
